title: Market Capitalization and Valuation Metrics of Nasdaq Inc

content.text: Nasdaq Inc currently has a market capitalization of approximately $26 billion.
1. Price-to-Earnings (P/E) Ratio: Nasdaq Inc has a P/E ratio of around 22, which is slightly higher than the industry average of 20.
2. Price-to-Sales (P/S) Ratio: The P/S ratio for Nasdaq Inc stands at approximately 5, which is similar to the industry average.
3. Price-to-Book (P/B) Ratio: The P/B ratio for Nasdaq Inc is around 3.5, which is also comparable to the industry average.
4. Dividend Yield: Nasdaq Inc currently has a dividend yield of 1.5%, which is lower than the industry average of 2.2%.
5. Earnings Per Share (EPS): The EPS for Nasdaq Inc is $4.80, slightly higher than the industry average of $4.50.

Overall, Nasdaq Inc has a relatively high market capitalization and valuation metrics that are largely in line with industry benchmarks. However, its P/E ratio is slightly higher and dividend yield is lower compared to the industry average.

news.headline: Nasdaq Inc's Dividend Analysis
news.summary: Nasdaq Inc (NASDAQ:NDAQ) recently announced a dividend of $0.22 per share, payable on 2024-03-28, with the ex-dividend date set for 2024-03-13.  As investors look forward to this upcoming payment, the spotlight also shines on the company's dividend history, yield, and growth rates.  Using the data from GuruFocus, let's look into Nasdaq Inc's dividend performance and assess its sustainability.

news.headline: Linde plc to Join the Nasdaq-100 Index® Beginning  March 18, 2024
news.summary: NEW YORK, March 08, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Nasdaq (Nasdaq: NDAQ) today announced that Linde plc (Nasdaq: LIN), will become a component of the Nasdaq-100 Index® (Nasdaq: NDX®), the Nasdaq-100 Equal Weighted™ Index (Nasdaq: NDXE™), the Nasdaq-100 Ex-Tech Sector™ Index (Nasdaq: NDXX™), and the Nasdaq-100 ESG™ Index (Nasdaq: NDXESG™) prior to market open on Monday, March 18, 2024.
